title: Projects
text:
spVarBayes: An R package for fast variational Bayesian inference in large-scale geospatial regression using Nearest Neighbor Gaussian Processes (NNGP). The method avoids auto-differentiation by leveraging closed-form gradient updates and linear response corrections, enabling accurate uncertainty quantification at reduced computational cost. [tutorial][https://jfsong100.github.io/spVarBayes/spVarBayes-tutorial.html] is available.
NeVI-Cut: Variational inference with normalizing flows for modular Bayes

title: Research
text: I work on scalable Bayesian inference, variational methods, and spatial models. - Fast Variational Inference for NNGP - Modular Bayes with normalizing flows - Applications in disease mapping and healthcare claims

title: Jiafang Song
text: I am a fifth-year PhD student in Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins University, advised by Dr.Â [Abhirup Datta][https://abhidatta.com]. My research focuses on variational inference and machine learning methods, including normalizing flows and neural networks. I previously earned an MS in Biostatistics from Yale University.
